availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Addison Graves (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and farmer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Anna Cabell Harrison Graves in Boone County, Kentucky, on November 21, 1842. Father of Louise Anna Graves, Charles A Graves, and Fannie C. Graves. Guardian of Jane E. Winn, Susan A. Winn, and Amanda L. Winn. Graduate of Transylvania University Law School in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1836. Farmer in Boone County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Boone County in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860. Attorney in Louisville in 1861.
